info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 24 at 3:56PM CDT until May 29 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Little Rock AR
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Little Rock has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Arkansas...
Spring River At Hardy affecting Fulton and Sharp Counties.
For the Spring River...including Hardy, Imboden...elevated river levels are forecast.
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Spring River at Hardy.
* WHEN...From this afternoon to early Thursday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Water is breaking out of the banks and flooding low lying areas along the river.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:30 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 8.2 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 9.0 feet Sunday morning. It will then briefly fall to 8.6 feet early Monday morning, before rising again to 9.5 feet early Tuesday morning. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. This forecast is primarily based on future rainfall over the next 48 hours. Continue to monitor latest forecasts for any updates. - Action stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route.
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts.
Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk
Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
The next statement will be issued Sunday afternoon at 400 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO EARLY THURSDAY MORNING
